name: Miso
properties: White miso is milder than red/dark miso
Should not be boiled (add after cooking)
benefits: Miso is a fermented food that adds deep umami flavor to soups and sauces without added salt. The fermentation process creates beneficial compounds and probiotics. White miso paste is commonly used in weight-loss recipes as a flavor enhancer.
amount: 1 teaspoon per recipe (typically in soups and dressings)

quotes: 1 teaspoon white miso paste - add to hot broth and stir until blended
In a small bowl, combine the miso paste with about 1/4 cup/60ml of the hot broth, stirring to blend. Pour the miso mixture into the soup.
